definition: (fig.) to hold in one's hands/to be within grasp
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
to be in a position of power
lit. to hold the pearl of wisdom (idiom)/fig. to be endowed with extraordinary intelligence
to be assured of success (idiom)

sentences.english: However, in phones, Google seems to have a winner on its hands.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，在手機上谷歌似乎已經勝券在握。

sentences.english: French estimates were that the Viet Minh had minimal artillery support, and France was bound to win.
sentences.chinese: 據法國估計，越盟幾乎沒有大炮助陣，法軍勝券在握。

sentences.english: It's in the cards for him to win the competition.
sentences.chinese: 針對他而言，贏得這次競賽已左券在握。

sentences.english: Once in power, they are ruthless in suppressing the rights of others.
sentences.chinese: 一旦其大權在握，就會無情踐踏他人的權利。

sentences.english: Well, Warners are so confident that they have a hit on their hands that the sequel is already under way.
sentences.chinese: 呃，華納已經信心滿滿地認爲勝券在握了。

sentences.english: I was beside myself with excitement and joy. Maybe this time, I could finally win.
sentences.chinese: 我欣喜若狂，也許這回勝券在握了。

sentences.english: And now the Brown government is poised to win passage in the House of Lords, too.
sentences.chinese: 目前戈登政府對議會上院通過該法案也是勝券在握。

sentences.english: I asked him if he was missing the power.
sentences.chinese: 我問他是否懷念權力在握的感覺。

sentences.english: They shook hands and he whispered to the pastor.
sentences.chinese: 在握了握手之後，他便在牧師耳根小聲耳語着什麼。

sentences.english: By doing this, I'll be able to hold a knife at the same time and still keep the gun steady.
sentences.chinese: 這樣做，我就可以在握刀的同時保持槍身的穩定。

sentences.english: Yoga helps put your health in your hands.
sentences.chinese: 瑜伽使你的健康勝券在握。

sentences.english: You have it in the bag, Senator.
sentences.chinese: 參議員，你已經勝券在握了。

definition: grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
to be in a position of power
lit. to hold the pearl of wisdom (idiom)/fig. to be endowed with extraordinary intelligence
power/authority
military leadership/military power
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
see 胸有成竹[xiong1 you3 cheng2 zhu2]
easily obtained/readily available
authority
life-and-death power/ultimate power
calm/unruffled
to win power/to get authority/to become dominant
elite soldiers, ample provisions (idiom); well-prepared forces/preparations for war are in an advanced state
